decision_conditions: The proposed rear extension, by virtue of its depth and height along the shared boundaries and in combination with the raised terrace would represent an excessive, disproportionate form of development which would be an overly dominant addition to the host dwelling and would conflict with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021, Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames LDF Core Strategy (Adopted April 2012) and Policy Guidance 33 of the Residential Design SPD (Adopted July 2013).

The proposed rear extension, by virtue of its depth and height along the shared boundaries and in combination with the raised terrace would result in an unacceptable adverse impact upon the amenity of neighbouring properties No. 271 and 273 Richmond Road in terms of overbearing impact, loss of outlook, loss of privacy and undue sense of enclosure, thereby conflicting with Policy D3 of the London Plan, 2021, Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy, 2012 and Policy Guidance 33 of the Residential Design SPD, 2013.

It has not been demonstrated to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority that the proposal would not cause harm to the health and longevity of the tree in the neighbouring garden of No. 275 Richmond Road, Kingston, thereby conflicting with Paragraph 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), Policy G7 of the London PLan 2021, Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Council's Core Strategy (2012) and Policy Guidance 7 of the Residential Design SPD (Adopted July 2013).
description: Erection of single storey rear extension and installation of raised rear terrace.
